extension.name: com.cloudera.processors.cef.CefWriter
extension.description: Builds and outputs a CEF record using configured flowfile attributes or hard-coded values for use by Arcsight and other SIEM applications that utilize the CEF format

property.name: USE_COMPLEX_HEADER
property.description: Use the complex header for the first CEF field. This consists of the event date time, event host, and cef version separated by spaces. Setting this to true requires the optional properties 'Event Data' and 'Event Host' to be populated. If these properties are not set, flowfiles will fail to process. NOTE: not all downstream applications are configured to support complex headers in CEF records. Make sure your application can handle this before enabling this option.

property.name: CONTENT_AS_MSG
property.description: Set the content of the flowfile as the value of the 'msg' property in the Extension field of the cef recordNOTE: depending on downstream requirements, this could result in a very large record that may not be supported. Use with caution.

property.name: SYSLOG_PREFIX
property.description: The first field of a CEF object. Example: CEF:1

property.name: DEVICE_VENDOR
property.description: The second field of a CEF object. Example: Security

property.name: DEVICE_PRODUCT
property.description: The third field of a CEF object. Example: threatmanager

property.name: DEVICE_VERSION
property.description: The fourth field of a CEF object. Example: 1.0

property.name: DEVICE_CLASS_ID
property.description: The fifth field of a CEF object. Example: 100

property.name: EVENT_NAME
property.description: The sixth field of a CEF object. Example: worm successfully stopped

property.name: EVENT_SEVERITY
property.description: The seventh field of a CEF object. Example: 10

property.name: EVENT_DATE
property.description: Optional datetime value that can be part of the Header. Example: Sept 29 08:26:10

property.name: EVENT_HOST
property.description: Optional hostname value that can be part of the Header. Example: host.example.com

dynamicProperty.name: A FlowFile attribute used in the CEF Extension field
dynamicProperty.value: The value to set it to
dynamicProperty.description: Dynamic Property names and values are used as the key/value of additional CEF fields stored in the CEF Extension field. These names must conform to the CEF schema or user-defined additional custom field names implemented in downstream applications

relationship.name: Failure
relationship.description: The flowfile has failed to be processed to CEF successfully

relationship.name: Success
relationship.description: The flowfile has been successfully processed to CEF

writesAttribute.name: See additional details
writesAttribute.description: This processor may write or remove zero or more attributes as described in additional details
